attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dozens of these things arrive in my inbox every week. And it's getting worse. I love my friends, but some of them are stupid and shouldn't have a voice. They forward me these fear based e-petitions, with their Daily Mail top-lines telling me that Tony Blair wants to put a tag on my children and turn my car into a hill, and that this is a basic breach of my human rights and must be quashed. But I don’t care. 

Not a single one of these petitions (including this one) puts forward both sides of an argument or provides us with an opportunity to learn more about what we’re putting our name to. Of course not all are bad and I’m sure a great many have a very fair point to make, but the ones that seem to be doing the spam rounds are manipulative, populist, fear driven idiot lists that potentially serve to do more harm than good; assuming, that is, that anyone is actually listening to these things and that the whole thing isn’t just a lovely, placatory bone to chew on.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
